nodes.bodyText:
Nit: Drop the exclamation mark.
But my larger question is why we are offline here. Is this because we kick off going online only after this API call finishes (like we discussed before)?

If calling .get() works for these tests, this could be as simple as
ref.setValue(42).get() followed by ref.get().get().
Please drop exclamation mark as this is user facing. Maybe make this "Client is offline".
Please also port the logging changes from JS.
Do we need to special case 404 as well and treat it as a successful response?
Does this need to be added to the Web PR?
I am not sure what the intent of these 5 lines is. It seems like the test would be the same without them?
You can just add ExecutionException to throws.
You can just add ExecutionException to throws.
Maybe s/semaphore/readerSemphore
Did you consider using ReadFuture to simplify this setup?

Our implementation should also go online without this write. Right now, this test throws "Client is offline" without the previous write. We need to wait until the client goes online and then return the result.

Please also add a test that shows the the value is still cached even when there are no remaining listeners. The SDK should keep up to 10 MB of least recently used data. For this to work, you have to track the query via the persistence manager. See here: 
  
    
      firebase-android-sdk/firebase-database/src/main/java/com/google/firebase/database/core/SyncTree.java
    
    
         Line 505
      in
      d920962
    
    
    
    

        
          
           persistenceManager.setQueryActive(query);
I think this catch can be removed.
This catch can be removed.
I think my comment earlier wasn't applicable... but it does seem that this is now a ReadFuture.
This method seems unused.

It took me a while to wade through all the callsites, but it seems like executorService is single-threaded and the is responsible for all access to outstandingGets. This means that markSent doesn't need to use an AtomicBoolean.
This should only ever be hit when cancelled, or not?
Can this be done in the OnCompletedListener?
This is much easier than I thought it would be. Thanks for figuring this out.

commit.message: comment + remove action from outstanding get

nodes.bodyText:
Looks like we can inline prev and drop the this..
This function should probably also have a short comment on what the return type is - or a more descriptive name.
Could we just use outstandingGet here rather than retrieve it from the list?
Please remove
